meanings.definition: Having the same number of calories.
meanings.sent1: The two snacks were isocaloric, meaning they had the same amount of calories.
meanings.sent2: It is important to choose isocaloric options when comparing food items for a balanced diet.
meanings.sent3: I tried to trick my friend by offering two isocaloric candies, but they caught on to my prank.
meanings.sent4: The isocaloric nature of the two drinks made them perfect substitutes for each other.
meanings.sent5: Her meal plan focused on isocaloric meals to maintain a healthy weight.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a diet with equal caloric intake.
meanings.sent1: An isocaloric diet ensures that the body receives the same amount of energy each day.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often follow an isocaloric diet to maintain their performance levels.
meanings.sent3: The isocaloric meal plan made it easier for the group to share food without any arguments.
meanings.sent4: In a world of isocaloric diets, everyone would have the same energy levels.
meanings.sent5: The isocaloric nature of the menu catered to individuals with specific dietary needs.
